latest news.eng_title: IOC's Bronze-Medal Verdict Caused Rift Between Romanian Gymnastics Teammates
latest news.summary: Romanian gymnasts Ana Barbosu and Sabrina Maneca-Voinea tied for third place in the floor exercise at the 2024 Paris Olympics with a score of 13.700, but Barbosu was awarded the bronze medal due to a higher execution score. However, this decision has caused a rift between the teammates, with Barbosu admitting that Maneca-Voinea has been distant from her. Romanian Olympic and Sports Committee president Mihai Covaliu initially disputed the results, believing that Maneca-Voinea should have been awarded the medal due to a 0.100-point deduction for her foot allegedly touching out of bounds, which was later found to be incorrect. According to Barbosu, 'It will pass, we need the team further.'
latest news.title: IOC's Bronze-Medal Verdict Caused Rift Between Romanian Gymnastics Teammates

latest news.eng_title: Olympic Medalist Has Strong Opinion on Jordan Chiles Not Returning Bronze Medal
latest news.summary: USA Gymnastics is appealing a Court of Arbitration for Sport ruling that stripped Jordan Chiles of her Olympic bronze medal. Former Olympian Laurie Hernandez expressed a strong opinion on the situation, saying, 'I hate to say it, but it's very important to the International Olympic Committee that they get that medal back.' Hernandez acknowledged that Chiles is heartbroken and that the situation is 'a really messy situation.' Chiles is still in possession of the physical medal, according to Christine Brennan of USA Today. USAG plans to appeal the decision to the Swiss Federal Tribunal, which has the power to overrule CAS decisions.
latest news.title: Olympic Medalist Has Strong Opinion on Jordan Chiles Not Returning Bronze Medal

latest news.eng_title: Fans Rally Behind Jordan Chiles' Refusal to Return Bronze Medal
latest news.summary: American gymnast Jordan Chiles has 'no plans' to return her bronze medal from the Paris Olympics as USA Gymnastics continues its appeal process. Fans are rallying behind Chiles, with many expressing support for her decision to hold onto the medal. According to Christine Brennan of USA Today, U.S. officials plan to appeal the Court of Arbitration for Sport's ruling, citing 'significant procedural errors.' Chiles initially claimed third place in the floor exercise finals, but a score inquiry from the USA Gymnastics coaching staff led to a 0.1 score bump, which was deemed invalid by CAS. The IOC upheld the ruling, reallocating the medal to Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu, who was awarded the bronze medal in a ceremony on Friday. Fans are showing their support for Chiles on social media, with one fan writing, 'AS. SHE. SHOULDN'T. you earned that @ChilesJordan!' and another saying, 'Good for her!!!! Keep it!'
latest news.title: Fans Rally Behind Jordan Chiles' Refusal to Return Bronze Medal

latest news.eng_title: American gymnast Jordan Chiles has ‘no plans' to return bronze medal amid Olympics controversy: report
latest news.summary: American gymnast Jordan Chiles was stripped of her bronze medal title in the women's floor exercise final at the 2024 Paris Olympics after a ruling from the Court of Arbitration (CAS) restored the podium to include Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu. However, Chiles has 'no plans' to return the medal, according to USA Today's Christine Brennan, as Team USA plans to continue its pursuit of an appeal. Chiles initially finished fifth in the eight-woman final before her score was boosted by .1, bumping Barbosu out of medal contention. Romania protested the decision to the CAS, arguing that the appeal was not made within the permitted one-minute time frame. The appeal was successful, and Barbosu was awarded the bronze medal. Chiles has called the decision 'unjust' and still has possession of the medal in the United States.
latest news.title: American gymnast Jordan Chiles has ‘no plans' to return bronze medal amid Olympics controversy: report

latest news.eng_title: Jordan Chiles has 'no plans' to return bronze medal amid Olympics controversy: report
latest news.summary: American gymnast Jordan Chiles was stripped of her bronze medal in the women's floor exercise final at the 2024 Paris Olympics after a ruling from the Court of Arbitration (CAS) restored the podium to include Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu. However, Chiles has 'no plans' to return the medal as Team USA plans to continue its pursuit of an appeal, citing 'significant procedural errors' by CAS. Chiles has called the decision 'unjust' and still has possession of the bronze medal in the United States. USA officials plan to appeal the decision to the Swiss Federal Tribunal.
latest news.title: Jordan Chiles has 'no plans' to return bronze medal amid Olympics controversy: report

latest news.eng_title: American Gymnast Jordan Chiles Plans On Keeping Her Bronze Medal, Despite CAS Ruling
latest news.summary: American gymnast Jordan Chiles may have been officially stripped of her bronze medal from the 2024 Summer Olympics due to a Court of Arbitration for Sports (CAS) ruling, but she plans to continue holding onto it. According to USA Today's Christine Brennan, Chiles and her team will appeal the decision, citing 'significant procedural errors' by CAS. The next step would be to file an appeal in the Swiss Federal Supreme Court, with no exact time frame on how long the process will take. Chiles has already received her medal from the ceremony at the Olympics and has no plans to give it back, as stated by Brennan: 'There are no plans for Chiles to give the bronze medal back.'
latest news.title: American Gymnast Jordan Chiles Plans On Keeping Her Bronze Medal, Despite CAS Ruling

latest news.eng_title: Jordan Chiles Reportedly Has 'No Plans' To Return Her Bronze Medal
latest news.summary: Jordan Chiles has reportedly 'no plans' to return her bronze medal in the floor exercise event, despite the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) stripping her of the medal due to a judging error. The USA submitted an appeal to CAS, but the decision is final, and USA Gymnastics plans to take the matter to the Swiss high court. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has given Romania clearance to award Ana Barbosu with her own bronze medal, which was originally allocated to Chiles. Chiles has expressed that the IOC's decision 'feels unjust' and has confidence that justice will be done, stating 'I will approach this challenge as I have others––and will make every effort to ensure that justice is done.'
latest news.title: Jordan Chiles Reportedly Has 'No Plans' To Return Her Bronze Medal

latest news.eng_title: Jordan Chiles Reacts to Loss of Bronze Medal at Paris Olympics
latest news.summary: US gymnast Jordan Chiles expressed that the decision to take away her bronze medal 'feels unfair' and is 'a hard blow'. The Court of Arbitration for Sport (TAS) ruled that Romanian Ana Bărbosu is the legitimate winner of the bronze medal in the floor exercise at the Paris Olympics. Chiles said, 'I'm overwhelmed by the love I've received in the last few days. I'm also very grateful to my family, teammates, coaches, fans, USAG, and USOPC for their unwavering support during this difficult time.' However, she added, 'I had confidence in the appeal presented by USAG, who provided conclusive evidence that my score followed all the rules. This appeal was unsuccessful.' The TAS decision led the International Olympic Committee (IOC) to ask Chiles to return the bronze medal that was initially awarded to her. Chiles concluded, 'I'm facing one of the most challenging moments of my career. I'll face this challenge as I have with others, and I'll do everything possible to ensure justice is done. I believe that in the end, those in control will do the right thing.'
latest news.title: La gimnasta estadounidense Jordan Chiles dice que haber sido despojada de la medalla de bronce 'se siente injusto' y un es 'golpe duro'

news knowledge.eng_title: Olympic bronze medal for women's floor exercise reallocated to Ana Barbosu
news knowledge.summary: Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu has been awarded an Olympic bronze medal for the women's floor exercise at the Paris 2024 Olympics, after a ruling by the Court of Arbitration for Sport voided an appeal by Team USA coach Cecile Landi. The appeal had vaulted Chiles into third place and pushed Barbosu down to fourth. According to the Court of Arbitration for Sport, 'the appeal was voided due to a procedural error.' Barbosu said, 'I am overjoyed to receive this medal, it's a dream come true.' The ceremony took place in Bucharest, Romania on August 16, 2024.
news knowledge.title: Olympic bronze medal for women's floor exercise reallocated to Ana Barbosu

news knowledge.eng_title: Romanian Ana Barbosu Awarded Bronze Medal in Women's Gymnastics at 2024 Paris Olympics
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has reallocated the bronze medal in the women's artistic gymnastics floor exercise event from the 2024 Paris Olympics from American Jordan Chiles to Romanian Ana Barbosu. According to the IOC, 'We are in contact with the Romanian National Olympic Committee to discuss the medal reallocation ceremony and with the US Olympic Committee regarding the return of the bronze medal', a spokesperson told AFP. This decision follows a ruling by the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) on Saturday, which annulled Chiles' appeal due to a late submission. Barbosu, who was initially announced as third-place finisher on Tuesday, had even raised the Romanian flag in the Arena Bercy before being relegated to fourth place after Chiles' appeal. Romania now ends the Paris Olympics with nine medals, ranking 23rd in the country standings. Brazilian gymnast Rebeca Andrade was crowned Olympic champion in the floor exercise event on August 5, ahead of American Simone Biles.
news knowledge.title: JO 2024 (gym): l'Américaine Jordan Chiles sommée de rendre sa médaille de bronze, une 9e breloque pour la Roumanie

news knowledge.eng_title: Ana Barbosu Reinstated as Bronze Medalist in Women's Floor Exercise at Paris 2024 Olympics
news knowledge.summary: The International Gymnastics Federation (FIG) has reinstated Ana Barbosu of Romania as the bronze medalist in the women's floor exercise at the Paris 2024 Olympics, after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (TAS) overturned an appeal by Jordan Chiles' coach, Cecile Landi. The appeal was made after Landi requested that the judges reinstate an element in Chiles' routine, which increased her score by 0.1 and put her in third place. However, the FIG rules require that any appeal must be made within one minute of the score being published, and the TAS ruled that Landi's appeal was made 1 minute and 4 seconds after the deadline. As a result, the original order was reinstated, and Barbosu was awarded the bronze medal. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) confirmed the reassignment of the medal less than 24 hours after the TAS decision. According to the IOC, the FIG will determine the final classification, but the medal will be awarded 'in accordance with' the TAS decision. The FIG placed Barbosu in third place, Maneca-Voinea in fourth, and Chiles in fifth. The IOC announced that the bronze medal will indeed go to Barbosu and that they will work with the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee to return the bronze medal awarded to Chiles. 'It was a great day,' said Cecile Landi, Chiles' personal coach and also the coach of the US team in Paris, 'but unfortunately, it was not meant to be.'
news knowledge.title: Escándalo antes del final de París 2024: le quitaron una medalla a una gimnasta de EEUU

news knowledge.eng_title: 2024 Paris Olympics: US Jordan Chiles Stripped of Bronze Medal in Floor Exercise, Given to Romania's Ana Barbosu
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has announced that the bronze medal won by American gymnast Jordan Chiles in the floor exercise at the Paris Games will be stripped and given to Romanian Ana Bărbosu. This decision comes after a Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) ruling that the initial inquiry made by the USA over Chiles' score was filed after the one-minute deadline. The IOC stated, 'Following the CAS decision with regard to the Women's Artistic Gymnastics Floor Exercise Final and the amendment of the ranking by the International Gymnastics Federation, the IOC will reallocate the bronze medal to Ana Barbosu (Romania).' The US Olympic and Paralympic Committee (USOPC) has announced that it will appeal the decision, stating, 'We firmly believe that Jordan rightfully earned the bronze medal, and there were critical errors in both the initial scoring by the International Gymnastics Federation (FIG) and the subsequent CAS appeal process that need to be addressed.'
news knowledge.title: 2024 Paris Olympics: US Jordan Chiles Stripped of Bronze Medal in Floor Exercise, Given to Romania's Ana Barbosu

news knowledge.eng_title: Court strips US gymnast of bronze medal at Paris Olympics 2024
news knowledge.summary: A court has ordered US gymnast Jordan Chiles to return the bronze medal she won at the Paris Olympics 2024. The International Olympic Committee (IOC) announced that the medal will be reallocated to Ana Barbosu of Romania after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) ruled in favour of their appeal. The issue stemmed from confusion in the scoring during the women's floor exercise final, where Barbosu and Sabrina Maneca-Voinea finished with matching scores, but Jordan Chiles's score was adjusted, surpassing them. The Romanian team filed an appeal, stating that Team USA appealed outside the one-minute time limit, which the CAS upheld. Following the verdict, USA Gymnastics and the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee said, 'We are devastated by the Court of Arbitration for Sport ruling regarding women's floor exercise.' They believed their inquiry into the Difficulty Value of Jordan Chiles' floor exercise routine was filed in good faith and in accordance with FIG rules. The International Gymnastics Federation (FIG) restored the original scoring, placing Barbosu back in third, Maneca-Voinea fourth, and Chiles fifth.
news knowledge.title: Court strips US gymnast of bronze medal at Paris Olympics 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: Jordan Chiles Stripped of Bronze Medal in 2024 Olympics Floor Exercise - E! Online
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has ordered Jordan Chiles to return her bronze medal from the 2024 Paris Olympics floor exercise event. This decision comes after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) invalidated an inquiry that had raised Chiles' score, allowing Romania's Ana Barbosu to take the No. 3 spot. According to the IOC, 'Following the CAS decision with regard to the Women's Artistic Gymnastics Floor Exercise Final and the amendment of the ranking by the International Gymnastics Federation, the IOC will reallocate the bronze medal to Ana Barbosu (Romania).' The IOC is in touch with the Romanian National Olympic Committee and the USOPC to discuss the reallocation ceremony and the return of the medal.
news knowledge.title: Jordan Chiles Stripped of Bronze Medal in 2024 Olympics Floor Exercise - E! Online

news knowledge.eng_title: CIO to Reassign Bronze Medal in Women's Gymnastics Floor Exercise Event
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (CIO) has announced that it will reassign the bronze medal in the women's gymnastics floor exercise event from the 2024 Paris Olympics, originally awarded to American Jordan Chiles, to Romanian Ana Barbosu. According to a CIO spokesperson, 'We are in contact with the Romanian National Olympic Committee to discuss the reallocation ceremony and with the US Olympic Committee regarding the return of the bronze medal.' This decision follows a ruling by the Court of Arbitration for Sport (TAS) on Saturday, which annulled Chiles' score due to a late appeal. As a result, Barbosu will receive the bronze medal. Initially ranked third on Tuesday, the 18-year-old gymnast had even raised the Romanian flag in the Arena Bercy before being relegated to fourth place after Chiles' appeal. Brazilian gymnast Rebeca Andrade was crowned Olympic champion in the floor exercise event on August 5, with Simone Biles finishing second and Chiles initially in third place.
news knowledge.title: Gym au sol : le CIO va réallouer le bronze à la Roumaine Barbosu

news knowledge.eng_title: IOC to Reassign Bronze Medal in Women's Floor Exercise to Ana Barbosu
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has announced that it will reassign the bronze medal in the women's floor exercise at the Paris 2024 Olympics from American gymnast Jordan Chiles to Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu. According to a spokesperson, 'We are in contact with the Romanian National Olympic Committee to discuss the reallocation ceremony, and with the US Olympic Committee regarding the restitution of the bronze medal.' This decision comes after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) ruled that Chiles' appeal was filed four seconds after the deadline, which was set at one minute. As a result, Ana Barbosu will receive the bronze medal. Initially announced as third place on Tuesday, the 18-year-old gymnast had even waved the Romanian flag in the Arena Bercy before being relegated to fourth place after Chiles' appeal. Brazilian gymnast Rebeca Andrade was crowned Olympic champion in the floor exercise on August 5, with American Simone Biles finishing second.
news knowledge.title: JO Paris 2024, gymnastique : le CIO va réallouer la médaille de bronze à la Roumaine Ana Barbosu

news knowledge.eng_title: CIO to Reassign Bronze Medal in Women's Gymnastics Floor Exercise Event
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (CIO) has announced that it will reassign the bronze medal in the women's gymnastics floor exercise event from the Paris Olympics to Romanian gymnast Ana Barbosu. This decision comes after the Court of Arbitration for Sport (TAS) ruled that the appeal by American gymnast Jordan Chiles was invalid because it was submitted four seconds after the deadline. As a result, Barbosu will receive the bronze medal. Barbosu was initially announced as third place on Tuesday and even raised the Romanian flag in the Arena Bercy before being relegated to fourth place after Chiles' appeal. The decision has been made in consultation with the Romanian and American Olympic committees. 'We are in contact with the Romanian Olympic Committee to discuss the medal reallocation ceremony and with the US Olympic Committee regarding the return of the bronze medal,' said a CIO spokesperson to AFP.
news knowledge.title: JO - Gymnastique au sol: le CIO va réallouer le bronze à la Roumaine Barbosu

news knowledge.eng_title: Paris Olympics: American gymnast Jordan Chiles stripped of bronze medal (Ld)
news knowledge.summary: The International Olympic Committee (IOC) has announced that the bronze medal given to American gymnast Jordan Chiles in the floor exercise at the Paris Games will be reallocated to Ana Barbosu of Romania. This decision comes after a Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) ruling upheld an appeal by the Romanian Olympic Committee that an inquiry submitted by the USA about Chiles' score in the gymnastics floor exercise final was filed beyond the 1-minute deadline. According to the IOC, 'The IOC will reallocate the bronze medal to Ana Barbosu (Romania). We are in touch with the NOC of Romania to discuss the reallocation ceremony and with USOPC regarding the return of the bronze medal.' The International Gymnastics Federation (FIG) also confirmed that 'the ranking of the Women's Artistic Gymnastics Floor Exercise Finals has been modified accordingly, with Ana Barbosu (ROU) ranking third with a score of 13.700.' Jordan Chiles initially scored 13.666 in Monday's final, placing fifth, but her coach's appeal upgraded her score to 13.766, moving her to third place. The Romanian team protested, and the CAS ruling reinstated Chiles' original score of 13.666. USA Gymnastics and the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee issued a joint statement, saying, 'We are devastated by the Court of Arbitration for Sport ruling regarding women's floor exercise.' They also condemned the 'baseless and hurtful attacks' on social media against Jordan Chiles and commended her for conducting herself with integrity.
news knowledge.title: Paris Olympics: American gymnast Jordan Chiles stripped of bronze medal (Ld)
